description: Number of homeomorphically irreducible rooted trees (also known as series-reduced rooted trees, or rooted trees without nodes of degree 2) on n labeled nodes.
references: I. P. Goulden and D. M. Jackson, Combinatorial Enumeration, John Wiley and Sons, N.Y., 1983.
links: David Callan, A sign-reversing involution to count labeled lone-child-avoiding trees, arXiv:1406.7784 [math.CO], (30-June-2014)
formula: a(n)=n*(n - 2)!*Sum_{k=0..n - 2} ( - 1)^k*binomial(n, k)*(n - k)^(n - 2 - k)/(n - 2 - k)!, n>1. E.g.f.: x*(exp( - LambertW( - x/(1 + x))) - 1/2*(LambertW( - x/(1 + x)))^2).a(n) ~ n^(n-1) * (1-exp(-1))^(n+1/2). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 05 2013
mathematica: f[n_] := If[n < 2, 1, n(n - 2)!Sum[(-1)^k*Binomial[n, k](n - k)^(n - 2 - k)/(n - 2 - k)!, {k, 0, n - 2}]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 19}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 12 2005 *)
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 27 2001
